fields.description:
Launch Studio. Connect only one iOS or Android Device
Create classic/alloy app.
Click on Run.
Choose Refresh Devices options from Run menu

{color:green}*Expected Result:*{color}
1. Must get respective device name under iOS/Android Devices option.

{color:red}*Actual Result:*{color}
1.Will observe the respective device name is shown directly in the popup instead of under  iOS/Android Devices option where device name was shown previously. 

Note: Observed this issue after upgrading the studio build to (3.4.0.201408282203) and after installing latest sdk build(3.4.0.v20140829010914)

Please Refer to the screenshot attached.
fields.summary: Studio: Run Menu shows device name directly when only one device is connected instead off under iOS/Android Devices option
fields.environment:
Appcelerator Studio:3.4.0.201408282203
Sdk:3.4.0.v20140829010914
alloy:1.5.0-dev
titanium:3.4.0-dev
titanium-code-processor:1.1.1
acs:1.0.16
npm:1.3.2
OS:Maverick(10.9.4)
xcode: Xcode6Beta6

comments.body: Moving to CLI, as ti info output does not return iTunes Sync 'virtual' device.

Test environment
Mac osx 10.9.4 Maverics
Appcelerator Studio, build: 3.4.0.201408291834
Titanium SDK, build: 3.4.0.v20140829184521
acs@1.0.16
alloy@1.5.0-dev (git://github.com/appcelerator/alloy.git#28af71f2e10ca61929443277176323ec8746ee14)
install@0.1.7
npm@1.4.23
sudo@1.0.3
titanium@3.4.0-dev (git://github.com/appcelerator/titanium.git#be6d7a682c881e42246a2d31caac931b5f694024)
titanium-code-processor@1.1.1
Xcode6-Beta4
Device: iPhone 5S iOS 8.05b

Note: If only one Android device plugged in, it is visible in the Run Menu, if 2 Android devices connected, they can be selected from Android Device drop down menu.
What we are seeing here with Olga's comment is expected behavior. Closing as such.
